intro: Campylocentrum ulei var. peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces small, edible berries that are similar in appearance to starfruit but have a unique flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
